oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interior court of Beersheba Inn
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Detail of the interior court looking north at Beersheba Inn.

The Beersheba Springs Hotel was constructed over time by various owners, and was unified by additions made by Col. John Armfield around 1855. During the Civil War, the hotel had a wooden observatory where guest could watch the Confederate and Union activity in the valley below.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eason, W. Jeter
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Historic sites--Tennessee; Resorts--Tennessee
Hotels
